byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Richard Pérez-Peña and Jonah Engel Bromwich from New York. Reporting was contributed by Michael S. Schmidt from Washington, Alan Blinder and Patrick McGee from Dallas, Mark Landler from Warsaw, Julie Turkewitz from Colorado Springs, and Sewell Chan from London.
byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and JONAH ENGEL BROMWICH

abstract: Officials say sniper Micah Johnson's motive in Dallas shooting was to kill as many white police officers as possible, reality that many people have feared through two years of protests around United States against police violence; Johnson was Army veteran and had arsenal in his home that included bomb-making materials.
lead_paragraph: The shooting rampage committed by Micah Johnson, 25, was described as the kind of retaliatory violence that people have feared for the last two years.

headline.main: Five Dallas Officers Were Killed as Payback, Police Chief Says
headline.print_headline: Five Officers Killed as Payback, Chief Says

snippet: The shooting rampage committed by Micah Johnson, 25, was described as the kind of retaliatory violence that people have feared for the last two years....
